detail.content: Radiation Oncology Residency Training | Department of Radiation Oncology                                Skip to main content                      Patient Care       Faculty & Staff Directory       Events       Careers       Donate                                                                                                                                                                             Department of Radiation Oncology                                                                                  Home   Staff   Patient Care   Education & Training   Residency Training   Contact Us                                  Home Residency Training            Print  Email               - A + A                                         Residency Training      Overview   Philosophy   Information for Applicants   Information for Alumni   Teaching Conferences                                                                      Radiation Oncology Residency Training                                                      The Radiation Oncology Training Program at NYU Langone Medical Center is fully accredited by the ACGME for 4 years of study. The philosophical intent of the program is to train resident physicians in all fields of oncology. Although concentration will naturally be in radiation oncology, the relative place of surgery, chemotherapy and other treatment modalities is given emphasis to broaden the education and competence of trainees.   Located next to each other, the NYU Cancer Center, NYU Medical Center and Bellevue Hospital attract different patient populations and thus provide the radiation oncology resident with a broader experience in the spectrum of malignant disease than is generally available at a single institution. All residents receive appointments to both hospitals and spend time at each institution.   Learn more about our program:   Overview   Philosophy   Information for Applicants   Information for Alumni   Teaching Conferences                                                                                        NYU Langone Medical Center       Student Login       Library                 Policies & Disclaimers

Radiation Oncology Staff | Department of Radiation Oncology                                 Skip to main content                      Patient Care       Faculty & Staff Directory       Events       Careers       Donate                                                                                                                                                                             Department of Radiation Oncology                                                                                  Home   Staff   Patient Care   Education & Training   Residency Training   Contact Us                                  Home Staff            Print  Email               - A + A                                                                                                                  Radiation Oncology Staff    NYU Langone Medical Center Radiation Oncology prides itself on the dedication, warmth and professionalism of our entire staff. There are approximately 70 staff members in Radiation Oncology, and their functions vary from medical physics to social work. Our attending physicians are all certified by the American Board of Radiology, and our technologists are all licensed by the State of New York.   NYU Radiation Oncology is open Monday- Friday 7:00AM - 9:00PM and Sundays 8:00AM - 12:00PM.   Full Time Faculty   Silvia Formenti, M.D. , Professor and Chair, Department of Radiation Oncology, The Sandra and Edward H. Meyer Professor of Radiation Oncology, Professor of Medicine (Medical Oncology), Residency Program Director   Mary Helen Barcellos-Hoff, Ph.D. , Professor, Radiation Oncology and Cell Biology   Richard F. Cohen, M.D. , Assistant Professor   Nelly Huppert, M.D. , Assistant Professor   Stella Lymberis, M.D., Assistant Professor   Barry Rosenstein, Ph.D., Associate Professor, Radiation Biology   Nicholas Sanfilippo, M.D., Assistant Professor, Clinical Medical Director   Peter B. Schiff, M.D., Ph.D. , Professor   Joshua S. Silverman, M.D., Ph.D. Instructor, Radiation Oncology   Kevin Du, M.D., Ph.D. , Instructor, Radiation Oncology, Associate Residency Program Director   Brian K. Yeh, M.D., Ph.D. , Assistant Professor, Radiation Oncology   Physics Department   Keith DeWyngaert, Ph.D. , Director of Physics, Associate Director of Technical Operations, Associate Professor   Kerry Han, Ph.D. , Associate Professor   Gabor Jozsef, Ph.D. , Associate Professor   Stewart Becker, Ph.D. , Assistant Professor   Sunshine K. Osterman , Ph.D., Assistant Professor   Departmental Administration   Evelyn Gonzalez, Office Manager   Marcel Weinmann, Department Administrator   Emily Rawn, Residency Program Coordinator   Ravindran Kathirithamby, Director of Research                                                                               NYU Langone Medical Center       Student Login       Library                 Policies & Disclaimers

Radiation Oncology | Department of Radiation Oncology                                 Skip to main content                      Patient Care       Faculty & Staff Directory       Events       Careers       Donate                                                                                                                                                                             Department of Radiation Oncology                                                                                  Home   Staff   Patient Care   Education & Training   Residency Training   Contact Us                                  Home Home            Print  Email               - A + A                                                                                                                                           Radiation Oncology                                                      We strive to provide the highest quality medical care in an atmosphere of caring and warmth for patients of NYU Langone Medical Center, Perlmutter Cancer Center, The Hospital for Joint Diseases, New York University Downtown Hospital and Bellevue Hospital. It is our intent to make our patients as comfortable as possible during their treatment and to help them resume their normal lives and activities as quickly as possible. For patients whose disease warrants, both national and institutional research protocols are available.   NYU Medical Center Privacy and Security Policy   To schedule an appointment please call: 212-731-5003                                                             Education & Training                     Radiation Oncology Residency   Medical Physics Residency   Medical Students        More               Residency Training                     Overview   Philosophy   Information for Applicants        More               Contact Us                     Department Location        More                                                                News                       Dr. Formenti Named to New York Magazine 2012 “Best Doctors” List               + Read All News                                              NYU Langone Medical Center       Student Login       Library                 Policies & Disclaimers
